Review_Date: Benjy2 wrote a review Mar 24
Review_Text: I chose this hotel based on the fact that it is 5 star all inclusive but unfortunately I was a bit disappointed with some aspects of the hotel.  The main entrance of the hotel is stunning. Check in was quick and the lady at reception told us about the restaurants at the hotel. We were then taken to our room on a buggy which was very good. The grounds of the hotel are extensive. Very beautiful and green. Well looked after. The rooms are set quite a long walk from the pools restaurants and main part of the hotel. Anyone with mobility issues would find it a bit of a problem going to and from their room. Our room was supposed to be superior but I was quite disappointed with it. It was smaller than I expected. There is no wardrobe just a hanging rail and 2 small drawers. And it was very tired and in need of decorating. There were mosquitoes in the bathroom that dive bombed me when I had a shower. I think they came in from a broken vent. We never saw any mosquitoes when we were outside only in our bathroom. There was a kettle with tea and coffee but no milk. I didn't need milk but thought it unusual not to have any. I also thought we had a mini bar but in fact all we had was an empty fridge. This room was more 3/4* than 5*.On our first night I discovered that all inclusive doesn't actually mean all inclusive. There are 2 classes of all Inclusive and we were the one that didn't include the specialist restaurants most drinks and food at the pool bar at lunchtime. We could use those facilities but would need to pay for them. To me that isn't all inclusive. We were miss sold the holiday by the holiday company with this. The restaurant for my all inclusive was a buffet and the food choices weren't great. I've been to other all inclusive hotels with buffets but this one really wasn't good enough.  The hotel has 2 pools. The Zen pool which is quiet and the big pool. The pool looks lovely but the main problem for me was the slope going into the pool. It was very steep and slippery. I slipped and hurt my shoulder going in and I saw numerous people slip and hurt themselves. I've never seen so many people fall in a hotel swimming pool and I've been to a lot of hotels! The are sun beds round the pool but not a huge amount so I'm not sure what happens in tge height of summer. The hotel does a free shuttle bus than runs hourly into Marrakesh and is free. There is a gap of 3 hours between 12.30 and 3.30pm. The bus stops at the Tui Medina Gardens hotel. It's then about 20 minutes walk to the main part of Marrakesh. There were no directions to help us get to the centre and we found it a bit daunting. The roads are challenging to get across. 5 lanes of fast moving traffic that doesn't stop when you try and cross the road. Terrifying!  The best thing about the hotel was the staff. They were lovely. Always polite smiling and helpful. The barman remembered our drinks every night and Kamal at the pool was great doing the sports.  Unfortunately I won't come back to this hotel. There are too many things that aren't right. And it was very quiet. No atmosphere in the evening. This hotel could be amazing. The rooms need freshening up and the all inclusive needs to be all inclusive.

Review_Date: Lucy W wrote a review Oct 2022

There was a very distinct smell of drains in our rooms at times (!) but seeing as we were out during the day it didn't really matter. The table service for drinks can be v slow at times but the all inclusive rate made our whole stay excellent value for money.  Would recommend especially for families with children.

Review_Date: djcrt wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Disappointing hotel - does not live up to its 5 star status
Review_Text: I have never written a critical trip advisor review before but having been led to believe from previous reviews of this hotel that it was a fantastic hotel I feel moved to write a review on how I experienced the hotel.    Starting with the positives‚Ä¶    The hotel is set in lovely grounds and the garden maintenance team do a really good job at maintaining the gardens and they look great.  The pool areas are really nice - pools are clean (if a little chilly) with comfy sun beds lovely towels and bars with drinks and snacks.  The location is fine unless you want to be able to walk to the Medina. The hotel puts on a free regular shuttle to and from the Medina which is really useful.  Some of the staffbut sadly they are the minority want to ensure their guests have a really good stay. I feel I must call out Hajiba Walida Khalida and Mouad and few more junior staff in the restaurant who stood out amongst their peers. Please do send all your staff to the training that these members of the team went on. They make their customers feel welcome they try to go the extra mile.  However‚Ä¶.the elements that leave this hotel far from 5 star..  - the rooms are clean but tired - our first room had a toilet door that wouldn‚Äôt close. On returning to reception we did not receive an apology but simply a ‚Äúwe will change your room‚Äù. Having read more reviews since arriving here I see that needing to change rooms is not an infrequent situation.  - The food - it is ok with nice salads and breads and some nice dishes however it is very repetitive and would be impossible if you were vegetarian or gluten free as everything is mixed and there are few signs so you are never that clear on what you are eating.  - If you are not a smoker and are not keen on someone smoking next to you at meals or by the pool you might be disappointed. Despite signs saying no smoking by the pool this happened every day and also there are no designated areas at meal times.  - My biggest disappointment was the lack of customer service amongst many of the staff. All too often when you approach a member of staff they look frustrated to be approached they tell you what you need to do to find whatever it is you are looking for rather than attempt to help. There are tables left uncleared despite staff nearby yesterday‚Äôs drinks still by the pool despite three members of staff to man a quiet bar area. That bar the Zen bar will only serve bottled water to all inclusive guests making people walk to the other pool bar if they want any other all inclusive drinks.  -  - The reason this is the most disappointing area is that my experience of the supervisors and managers is that this is the culture and so all the refurbishments in the world would not change the experience the guest will have until there is a mindset change at the top and through the teams.

Review_Date: Michele P wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Initial appearance very clean modern hotel. Staff are lovely and very helpful.  Negative points: Food repetitive we stayed 4 nights and that was enough. Rooms: 3 couples in our group one couple was issued a room for a disabled person! Unfortunately I was not aware to get this changed till our second day realising when they said their sink was so low to the floor and I went to have a look and realised what this room was for but too late to change as we were only staying for 4 nights not worth the hassle. One room was OK and our room well needs a little TLC plus the patio doors did not lock. I complained 3 times and was told this would be fixed or we would be moved.... this never happened and I gave up as more hassle and again as we were only there 4 nights just wanted to enjoy our stay.  I do not consider myself to be a fussy person and accept you are in a different country that has different standards so I leave you all to make your own conclusions but bear these comments in mind. We were out on trips each day and half board so it served its purpose for us. Would I want a week stay here sorry to say no.  The pool area is lovely and no worries with getting a sunbed plus you get towels.  Maid service was good. Clean towels every day and beds made and turned down in the evening with a chocolate on your pillow lovely touch.  We went with 2 other couples to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary which I did email to let them know. Thought we might have got an added extra by mentioning this as some hotels are good at that we did not but then I guess we would if we had paid more.  Experience of Moroccan people absolutely lovely and changed my thoughts entirely to what I had expected.  Shuttle bus to and from the centre which is approximately 25 minutes away so very handy. Reception will also help you if you require a taxi etc and very helpful.  To sum up a lovely 4 night stay to get the experience of Morocco but the hotel did have a few disappointing issues but didn't spoil our mini break.

Review_Date: Nikki S wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Extortionate Bar prices ruins the experience.
Review_Text: We are currently staying at this property and whilst the hotel is very nice clean and comfortable we are staggered that on half-board you don‚Äôt even get water included with your meal.    Unless you are all-inclusive we would suggest you think very carefully about staying here when they are charging 30D For a bottle of water with your meal and an extortionate 50D for a 50cl bottle of Evian at the pool bar. The hotel is quite a way out so there is nowhere to walk to buy supplies however 2 km from the property is a hypermarket and there are taxis that sit in the road outside the hotel. There is also a carrefour outside the medina which we ventured to and for 90D we got all the Supplies in the photo including water at 3D for 1.5 L    It is a real shame because it leaves a bad taste in the mouth - they are exploiting their half-board guests and their markup is ridiculous. Surely it would be better to charge a reasonable amount for drinks and they would sell more rather than making such a profit that guests have to bring their own drinks in.    Stock up at the airport for alcohol or if you have a private transfer get the driver to stop off at the supermarket on your way to the hotel.    Additionally if you travel with voyage prive you are told you get a free hamman and massage where in fact it isn‚Äôt a full hamman it is just a steam room.    There is a shuttle bus that takes you into the Medina but the reception staff fail to tell you you need to book it in advance otherwise you can‚Äôt get on and if you want a taxi back from the Medina rather than waiting for the bus barter (we started at 200D & got it down to 80D)    This is the second time I have visited Morocco and I have to say my first experience was far better in every aspect.

Review_Date: Pinkfizz31 wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: We were not sure what to expect from this hotel as we booked very late and the price was very good compared to other hotels. Review_Text: My family and I were very excited to be visiting Marrakech after Christmas and had chosen our hotel carefully. NOT once has anyone contacted us for further information regarding a very uncomfortable encounter with a male member of staff. I would have thought given the circumstances and being a family hotel that they would very much be interested in our story. All I had asked was that they meet with their male staff to educate them on what was appropriate behaviour with their clientele. ALAS it is with a reluctance I write this review as it was only one member of staff whilst the others were so nice. I would definitely not be returning to this hotel with any members of our family. WE have travelled extensively and have never encountered any problems before our vacation at the Barcelo Palmeraie. What is most disappointing is the complete lack of interest from the General Manager of the Barcelo Palmeraie hotel after SEVENTEEN days or head office on this occasion. After all we are not talking about a bad breakfast but an entirely inappropriate incident with a male member of staff. Very disappointing from a 5 star hotel...very disappointing indeed.

It was very uncomfortable and very upsetting. I have since written to the HOTEL 3 times and the Barcelo Head office Customer services 4 Times and called their customer service centre 3 times. NOT once has anyone contacted us for further information regarding a very uncomfortable encounter with a male member of staff. I would have thought given the circumstances and being a family hotel that they would very much be interested in our story. All I had asked was that they meet with their male staff to educate them on what was appropriate behaviour with their clientele. ALAS it is with a reluctance I write this review as it was only one member of staff whilst the others were so nice. I would definitely not be returning to this hotel with any members of our family. WE have travelled extensively and have never encountered any problems before our vacation at the Barcelo Palmeraie. What is most disappointing is the complete lack of interest from the General Manager of the Barcelo Palmeraie hotel after SEVENTEEN days or head office on this occasion. After all we are not talking about a bad breakfast but an entirely inappropriate incident with a male member of staff. Very disappointing from a 5 star hotel...very disappointing indeed.

Review_Text: All round great family holiday and hotel. Pool was cold but I read this on a review before booking so was prepared (surely its just a case of turning up the thermostat?). Review_Date: catherine b wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Nice hotel and lovely staff but had some problems as a room with a decent view is not shown on their website and was told only available on checking in which we managed to do after a couple of days and paid a supplement just for the view - also All Inclusive package was a bit strange as not explained very well on arrival and they did not have any bands and put some drinks which we took on our bill and also they ran out of beer and wine at the swimming pool bar on our last day and charged you for drinks at the adults pool - also after joining Barcelo loyalty programme which advertised a welcome gift and a voucher for some money to spend at the hotel was not given and when brought up with the Reception manager was told they had no idea of it. Review_Date: Discover53058992525 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Well if I have to be honest although it was a lovely hotel the reception and new bar etc were very nice I wouldn‚Äôt say it was a 5 star hotel compared to other places and rooms I have stayed in. However the more i stayed at this hotel the more I really liked it and enjoyed it.  Our room didn‚Äôt have the best view like the pictures online from the room window. The fridge wasn‚Äôt working in the room however I didn‚Äôt tell the reception they probably would have changed it I just didn‚Äôt say anything ( my fault) The location is good and away from the hustle and bustle however it also meant that being in the complete middle of no where that there was no shops for snacks/drinks etc so had to buy everything at the hotel. Good Points  -Weather  Location  Free shuttle bus to the city center  Pools  Gym  Spa ( although it seemed quite pricy)    Not so good  No drink menus available  No shops nearby or snack shops on site  Fridge in room not working
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Calum W wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed here with friends in December for a long weekend and had a fantastic time.    Rooms were very clean modern and had an outdoor seating area.    We opted for All-Inclusive and ate in the buffet restaurant every night. Staff were very friendly in the restaurant and an excellent choice of food. There was always plenty of traditional Moroccan food to choose from as well as international options.    The bar area at night was very pleasant Nadia the waitress was especially helpful. She would also give you service with a smile and would try and build rapport with you over the duration of your stay.    The hotel grounds were very well-kept and there were golf buggys to take you around.    My only grumble was that the all-inclusive option did not include the a la Carte restaurants.    Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay the Pullman and would highly recommend to those visiting Marrakech. We would certainly return. Thanks Pullman!
